bibl.title: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to Joseph H. White, January 21, 1923

div1.p: [Carter] informs White of Lyster's visit and the danger of yellow fever in Tuxpan.

div1.head: Letter from [Henry Rose Carter] to Joseph H. White, January 21, 1923
div1.opener:
N. H. B.
White
2121 California St., N. W.,
Washington, D. C.,
January 21, 1923.
Dear White:
div1.p: Lyster was here last night and this is what he said:

That he regarded the district of Tuxpan as the most dangerous
area now left in Mexico. Not Tuxpan itself, but the area adjacent
thereto between the mountains and the sea: That he regarded it as
having been a permanent endemic area, like that on the Papaloapam
River: That he had sent Vaughan into this district in 1920, but had
to draw him out on account of the outbreak in British Honduras and
had intended to send him and at least one--if possible two others--
back into the Tuxpan district until it was cleared up.

He spoke of it being a hard country to live in and very difficult
to get about in after the rains begin and said that he thought your
plan would be to concentrate as many men as you could in this district--
brigadas volantes--and press the Stegomyia control during the dry
weather, holding, as he said you are doing, the districts of Vera Cruz
and Tampico with indices below the point of fever spreading if intro-
duced: That you could take men from distant sectors, clear of yellow
fever and not in communication with this district, for this work.

I am telling you all this, not knowing what it may be worth to
you, or if it be worth anything. You should be able to evaluate it.
I, naturally, cannot.

Lyster was not “knocking.” He came to consult me about writing
a paper on yellow fever for the next meeting of the American Tropical
Society--asked for by Dock--and decided not to do so. He spoke most
highly of you. He seemed, and I believe is, as much interested in
the elimination of yellow fever as you are or as I am.

I am leaving for a few days' stay in N. C. to-morrow night, but
hope to be back in time to see you while you are in Washington.
